alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 11:32PM CDT until June 01 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hancock County in west central Illinois... McDonough County in west central Illinois... * Until 530 AM CDT. * At 1132 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Macomb, Carthage, Bushnell, Colchester, Augusta, Bowen, Industry, Bardolph, West Point, Tennessee, Colmar, Fandon, Western Illinois University, Adair, New Philadelphia, Plymouth, Denver, Fountain Green, Basco and Bentley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
